title: 109_s542
content: Extension of renewable energy credit under Section 45(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change the date from January 1, 2006, to January 1, 2011. Treatment of persons unable to use the entire credit is addressed in the following section. Extension of renewable energy credit under Section 45(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change the date from January 1, 2006, to January 1, 2011. Treatment of persons unable to use the entire credit is addressed in a new paragraph added to Section 45(e). This paragraph allows for the transfer or use of the credit for qualified facilities owned by certain individuals. The credit allowance is independent of tax-exempt status for certain organizations or entities, including those exempt under section 501(c)(12)(C), section 1381(a)(2)(C), public utilities exempt under section 136(c)(2)(B), and States or political entities. The credit allowance can be transferred to other entities not exempt under specific sections, including States, political subdivisions, Indian tribal governments, and their agencies. The transfer of credit allowance can only be revoked with the Secretary's consent. Regulations will be prescribed to ensure the credit is assigned once and not reassigned. Proceeds from the transfer of credit are treated as arising from an essential government function. The Energy Tax Incentives Act allows for the transfer and use of credits as a prepayment of loans or obligations under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936. The transfer of credit allowance requires the Secretary's consent and must only be assigned once. The Energy Tax Incentives Act allows for the transfer and use of credits as a prepayment of loans or obligations under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936. Sales of electricity among persons described in subparagraph (A)(ii) shall be treated as sales between unrelated parties for tax purposes. The amendment applies to electricity produced and sold after the enactment of this Act.
